quest.name: Washed Up
journal: Staelwyrn is up in arms, as his hired hands are nowhere to be found.

Staelwyrn has work around Summerford Farms for his crew, but several of them are nowhere to be found. The old pirate captain requests that you round up the delinquent yeomen and send them back to him.
You have tracked down and spoken with all five yeomen. Report back to Staelwyrn.
Staelwyrn informs you that all the yeomen have returned to work except Sevrin. He is ill pleased by this, but does not hold you responsible for his own man's failings.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To accept this quest, you must abandon the current main scenario quest. Open the corresponding entry in the journal or duty list and select “Abandon.”

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: That sea-sloth Sevrin and his lot─never around when there's work to be done!

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: I'd sooner hire you for the sake of gettin' things done, but then the rapscallions would never learn.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: Round them up and let them know that Staelwyrn would like a word... And don't take “no” for an answer!

dialogue.name: SEVRIN
dialogue.text: Aye, I'm Sevrin. You the old man's errand girlboy, now?

dialogue.name: SEVRIN
dialogue.text: Tell my dear old captain not to wet his britches. I'll be along.

dialogue.name: SEVRIN
dialogue.text: Oh, and just so we're clear─I don't care for landlubbers. Go find the chocobo you rode in on, and ride on out.

dialogue.name: AYLMER
dialogue.text: So, Staelwyrn sent you. And what do you reckon I say to that?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What do you reckon he says?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Work is for the weak and witless.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I've saucier seeds to sow.

dialogue.name: AYLMER
dialogue.text: Damn right! Didn't get where I am by takin' guff from any glorified gardeners! ...But I s'pose I could see what he wants to get him off my back.

dialogue.name: EYRIMHUS
dialogue.text: Axes were made for splittin' skulls, not stumps! You know what I did in my sailin' days?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What did he do in his sailing days?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Skirmishing.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Wanton slaughter.

dialogue.name: EYRIMHUS
dialogue.text: You bet your bosombeard I did, lasslad! Aye, those were the days... <sigh> I reckon now I'll have to be satisfied takin' my axe to the trees.

dialogue.name: SOZAIRARZAI
dialogue.text: <groan> How am I supposed to work on an empty stomach? Go on, have a guess at what I had for breakfast.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What did he eat for breakfast?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Breaded sticks.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Ash tuna.

dialogue.name: SOZAIRARZAI
dialogue.text: Wha─ Gods, how'd you know!? It's my breath, ain't it? It probably smells as wooden as the food tasted... But I know why you're here. <sigh> I'd just as soon get some real food in me, but I ain't one to reject a summons from the cap'n.

dialogue.name: SDHODJBI
dialogue.text: Textless

dialogue.name: WAUTER
dialogue.text: Work? Ha! Can't work when me hands are full liftin' this mug. Ye know, I'd wager me last gil ye'd never guess what I'm drinkin'.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What do you think is in his mug?

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Swill water.

dialogue.name: A4
dialogue.text: Swill wine.

dialogue.name: SDHODJBI
dialogue.text: Textless

dialogue.name: WAUTER
dialogue.text: Well, yer right about the “swill” part. I reckon it might be worth a day o' doin' Staelwyrn's chores if it'll afford me a taste o' proper grog.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: You continue to impress, lasslad. All but Sevrin are accounted for.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: It's no fault of yours he squirmed out. I've let that worm wriggle through my fingers more times than I can count.

dialogue.name: STAELWYRN
dialogue.text: But rest assured, the next time I see him, I'll put him squarely in the dirt, where all such worms belong.
